title: A.J. Brown’s Eagles teammate doesn’t buy Patriots trade possibility
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: A.J. Brown linked to Patriots as potential trade target following rumors of discontent with Eagles.
Coach-Vrabel's history with Brown cited as a factor in speculative trade by ESPN's Adam Schefter.
Eagles' Saquon Barkley downplays trade rumors, attributing Brown's comments to being a Patriots fan.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: The National Weather Service warns of potential heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding from the nor'easter Sunday night into Monday.
Meteorologists predict the storm could bring over a foot of snow to metro Boston and South Shore/Cape areas.
Concerns include power outages due to heavy, wet snow and strong winds, with significant impacts expected in Southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman declines to discuss his decision to sign with the Cubs instead of re-signing with the Red Sox.
Red Sox president Sam Kennedy implied Bregman chose to leave Boston when speaking to reporters in Florida.
Bregman values the no-trade clause from Chicago, which was absent in Boston's contract offer.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now (Redux)' streaming on Pluto TV and Plex honors actor Robert Duvall's legacy at age 95.
'Blue Moon' by Richard Linklater, featuring Ethan Hawke, can now be streamed on Netflix.
'The Last Thing He Told Me' Season 2, starring Jennifer Garner, is available on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora says Marcelo Mayer must earn his spot on the Opening Day roster this spring training.
Cora emphasizes the need for Mayer to improve offensively, despite strong defensive and base-running performances last season.
Mayer, hindered by injuries in prior seasons, aims for a healthy spring to secure a position in the Red Sox infield.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists predict heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding in southeast MA and RI from Sunday night through Monday.
The National Weather Service reports potential for over a foot of snow on the South Shore and Cape Cod.
Power outages are a concern due to the expected heavy, wet snow and strong winds accompanying the nor'easter.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in court for the first time in-person since being accused of killing her three children in 2023.
The court discussed logistics ahead of Clancy's July murder trial, including motions, discovery status, and expert evaluations.
Clancy's defense plans an insanity plea, citing postpartum illness and overmedication as factors in the alleged crimes.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly of Delegates approved a transfer fee on home sales over $1 million, potentially raising $60 million annually.
The fee ranges from 0.5% to 4% and applies only to the sale portion exceeding $1 million, benefiting housing initiatives.
90% of the revenue goes to towns, with the remainder supporting a regional housing trust; towns choose adoption through local votes.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police are preparing for a planned 'Northshore Mall takeover' scheduled at 3 p.m. on Friday.
These 'takeover' events often involve large crowds blocking streets for car stunts like burnouts and drag racing.
A $14 million safety grant was issued by Gov. Maura Healey to aid in the prevention of such events.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven Harvard Street Gang members face charges for drug and firearm offenses across Eastern Massachusetts, officials confirm.
Authorities seized 25 firearms, drugs, and large amounts of cash in coordinated raids linked to the gang.
Court records show over 20 gang members previously charged; investigation since 2019 involved drugs, weapons, and violence.
